title: Is the statement, 'we all shine on' basically true? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you mean it in the sense that John Lennon intended in his song “Instant Karma” no, it is not true. In fact it has been the most commonly accepted lie at any time in history. As far as I can recall, the doctrine of the ‘immortality of the soul’ pervades virtually every world religion except for Christianity as founded by Jesus Christ on the Old Testament doctrine of human mortality and the resurrection from the dead. It is so pervasive that even the modern Christian church believes and teaches it in spite of the clear teachings of Jesus and the Bible itself. Genesis 3:19 “In the sweat of your face you shall eat breadTill you return to the ground,For out of it you were taken;For dust you are,And to dust you shall return.”
that’s a generous statement, but i don't think that it's true. i might say, “we shine here and there, once in a while, in our own ways.”
